availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Muhlenberg County, Kentucky, resident. Son of Washington and Indiana Bennett. Married to Fannie Bennett. Married to Martha P. Bennett. Father of Elizabeth V. Bennett, Martha A. Bennett, Edgar B. Bennett, Andrew J. Bennett, and Fanny P. Bennett. Resident of Muhlengerg County in 1850. Captain of Company A in the 10th Regiment Kentucky Cavalry (Johnson's). Enlisted in 1862 in Webster County, Kentucky, for 3 years. Known as Guerilla Jake. Captured in Salineville, Ohio, on July 26, 1863. Prisoner of War at Camp Chase, Ohio. Transferred to Ohio Penitentiary on September 16, 1863. Died on December 6, 1904.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Muhlenberg County, p. 230. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Overton County, Thirteenth District, p. 11. Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0056. Tennessee State Library and Archives; Nashville, Tennessee; Tennessee Death Records, 1908-1959 Roll M-19 (accessed through Ancestry.com).
